detailsOfAchievement: We are working on the folk art of India for the last two decades. Along with it we are also working on the Classical and creative dances and music of our country. For the last 11 years Nicwon is organising a cultural fair in Bally, Howrah, West Bengal. The main aim of the fair is to highlight the glorious culture of our nation. So in that fair Nicwon invites different cultural groups and organisations from all over the country to perform. The dances like Sangi Mukhota from Maharashtra, Bhawai from Rajasthan, Rauf from Kashmir, Holi and Peacock Dances from Uttar Pradesh, Jumur and Karam from Jharkhand, Rava and Boirathi from Assam, Kathakali and Mohiniattam from Kerala, Odishi from Odisha, Bharatnatyam from Tamil Nadu, Gouriya Nritya and the different folk dances like Chhou, Ravankata, Manabputul, Raibeshe, Gambhira, Puppet Dance, Gajan, Santal Dance of West Bengal performed in this fair. Every year the fair is based on a particular theme like The Role of Flute in the Folk Culture (2015),The Role of Boat in the Folk Culture (2014) etc . The students of local schools organises an exhibition on the theme of the fair. There are stalls of handicrafts from different parts of West Bengal. Many eminent persons like freedom fighter Brindaban Chandra Ghosh, poet Sankha Ghosh, filmmaker Sandip Ray, singer Amar Pal and many more celebrities and scholars of West Bengal are members of this organisation. Sahitya Akademy award winning writer Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay, Dadasaheb Falke winning actor Soumitra Chattopadhyay, Sabitri Chattopadhyay who recently got Padmashree Samman, eminent Bharatnatyam dance Guru Thankumani Kutty, Manipuri dance guru Kalavati Devi, eminent theatre personality Rudraprasad Sengupta also came to the fair and praised Nicwon. Sahitya Akademy and Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre also financially assisted us to do this fair. Nicwon is also publishing a monthly printed wall magazine on the Bally Railway station for the last 11 years. Moreover we are also doing passenger awareness programmes regularly with Eastern Railway. Nicwon also organises a Morning Procession on the birthday of our national poet Rabindranath Tagore for the last 17 years. The members sing songs, dances and perform street theatre on that procession. On that procession Nicwon arranges Raksha Bandhan, to celebrate the national integrity of the nation. Nicwon also arranges different workshops on dance, theatre and craft. Like Kanchan Roy from Purulia had done a workshop on Chhou and Nandikar had done a workshop on theatre. Artists from Avibekti of Bankura West Bengal had done a workshop on craft. Nicwon also made documentaries and film. The documentaries are made on Flute (Banshi Kahini), Boats (Nouka Katha) and many more items. The short film Sir Sabdhan is on a teacher and his pupils. The members of Nicwon have also written and performed many dance dramas like Nouko Yatra, Ful Futuk, Basuria and Chandragrahan. They are Nicwons own production.

detailsOfAchievement: CHIDAKASH KALALAY- Centre of Art and Divinity Committed to serve the traditional art and culture, CHIDAKASH KALALAY, is dedicated and determined to preserve, practice and propagate Indiaâ€™s intangible heritages. For that, as the first firm step, it has been housing the practice and performance of the knowledge of Bharataâ€™s Natya-parampara stated in Natyashastra, as been envisioned and researched as MARGA NATYA by Piyal Bhattacharya. Established In 2013, standing amidst the babel of modern society, this centre endeavours to build a consciousness about the richness and fervour of Indian heritages, importance of Guru-parampara and self-improvement within the young and inquisitive minds. To bring back and re-install the eternal practice of the transcendence through ancient art, music and dance is the aim of this group. As a means to quench the thirst of knowledge, for the youngâ€™uns of todayâ€™s society, the Centre conducts workshops at regular intervals, and stages performances of MARGA NATYA to present the improvement of tedious and thorough research of Piyal Bhattacharya. Along with that this Centre also houses small gathering and baithhaks of other Indian performanceheritages like Rudra Veena and Dhrupad.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: WE ARE RUNNING VIVEKANENDA ANATH ASHRAM UNDER COTTAGE SCHEME FOR DESTITUTE BOYS

Due to constant poverty and unemployment problem the young generation is suffering from frustration and despondency. They cannot express their sorrows and sufferings to anybody else. Due to constant poverty and unemployment alternative reaction played always to their mind. Result which drug addicts involved with larceny for lively hood and other bare necessities of life. The young do not know that the drug is a venomous position and injuries to health and also creates frenzy.

We are running the Destitute Home for boys under Cottage Scheme since last 1985. At present the strength of Destitute Home for boys are 25.All inmates are belongs to the poor classes’ family. At present they have inclination towards education but due to constant poverty and bad pecuniary condition all hopes of becoming a learned man are nipped in the bud. Govt. sent the such classes of inmates for admits to destitute home for boys to provide better education so that such kind of poor inmates

The Organization is running WOMEN HELP LINE under SWADHAR SCHEME from FEB 2009. The main object and activities of WOMEN HELP LINE is to collect the information of torture, oppress, rapped, trafficking and eve teasing women and girls after that send report to the police station for taking proper step and there after it is inform to other Govt. offices i.e. Panchayate office, Drug office, Mahila samity for support service care and protection the such categories of women and girls for taking proper

People of Schedule cast community are very too much poor they have no source of income. They earn their lively hood by way of traditional business i.e. net for catching fish, fishing rod and selling fish etc. Financial condition of the people of the schedule cast community is not sound as such they cannot provide education to their son. We have launched a hostel for S.C. student to provide education to the children of Schedule cast family. So that the S.C. children may prosper

We are running the Family Counseling Centre from 1994 for salving the marital dispute. In the present age every Family are suffering from various kind of complex such as marital dispute, polygamy, Dowry, unemployed, dissatisfaction for sexual hunger unable to issue child. When our counselor of F.C.C get information from family members police station the counselor enquire about this matter to assertion actual state of affairs.

At present age it is observe that due to break up of joint family the family members refused to live in the nuclear family. The nuclear family is a curse of the society. Due to live in nuclear family the bondage of love, affection and kindness, compassion, respect to the aged man of the family is being disappeared day by day. Aged persons of the family is regular torture and oppress by the son and even the aged persons get no food, clothes, health service, care and protection from the family.

We have started Observation home in the year 2012, January.The all J.C.L Boys of observation home under J.J.act of I.C.P.S are involved with various kind of antisocial activities . We are running the children home from the year 1998.We at first started the children home (formerly shelter home) with limited MR girls now its strength has reached to the 167.Eighteen staffs have been engaged to look after MR girls. There are two categories inmates i.e. mild and moderate.The inmates are homeless.

title: Darjeeling Society of Education Research and Development
detailsOfAchievement: With the support of the Help in suffering Australia who are specialists in animal health care the Society succeeded in establishing an animal shelter and hospital at Kalimpong where all the domestic animals of Kalimpong are given medical treatment More than 15 local people are employees of the shelter One branch also has been established at Lebong and a third one is in the pipeline to be established at Pedong In the history of Darjeeling the Society became the first organisation to publish Himalayan Journal of Education Research and Development highlighting the problems and issues faced by the Himalayan people and also on the need to conserve the valuable natural resources of the region through public education research and development initiatives Between 2010 and 2017 the Society has held more than ten workshops on medicinal plants and flori culture both at State and national levels The medicinal plants and ornamental plants hold immense potential for the economic development of the people and the region The State and National Plants Board of India have agreed to provide a major grant for the establishment of a model nursery The aim of the society is to bring about a green revolution in the field of medicinal plants for which the Darjeeling hill region is famous The state medicinal plants board of West Bengal has also agreed to provide a center for training the hill farmers in the domain of medicinal plants cultivation conservation and processing In the recognition of the highly productive activities of the society Prof Yonzone has been nominated a member of the technical screening committee of the state medicinal plants board recently The society has been instrumental in inspiring the orchid growers of hill region to revive the past flori culture fame of the region which led to the formation of the Darjeeling Himalayan Orchid Society under which several activities have been planned

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Vocational Training and capacity building of rural women for their economic empowerment.

To generate awareness on various social evils i.e. child marriage, trafficking, domestic violence, child labour, female foeticide etc. involving the common villagers, SHGs, student groups and other stakeholders.
Vocational training and capacity building of rural women for their economic empowerment.
Capacity building for the BLCPC members on child protection as well as smooth functioning of the committee as per ICPS guidelines.

The project was on strengthening community women economically by providing with Vocational training on Rexine Bag Making as well as linking them up with the markets. During this phase, 20 women got training and after that, 16 of them are now earning Rs. 2500/- per month by making rexine bags at home. 7 of them bought their own machines through loans taken from Anadadhara Scheme and now earning more than the others.

title: Deshopriyo Kolkata Cultural Centre
detailsOfAchievement: Deshopriyo Kolkata Cultural Centre was the brainchild of late Ajoy Sen and Guru Sushmita Banerjee.It began with the mission to address the cultural crisis that young struggling artists have to face.The centre provided platforms and forums for these young artists to perform.This nurtured their talent. With passage of time the centre concentrated on training students in Kathak.The centre has imparted training to over 500 students over the years.Many of its students have excelled in national examinations such as Prayag Sangeet Samiti.The students have won accolades in national and international competitions.They have won national competitions such as Akhil Bharatiya Sanskrutik Sangh,Pune Theater Movement Patiala and International Dance Olympiad in Bangkok and Dubai. The Centre is a non profit making organisation dependant on grants and self financing from its office bearers.

detailsOfAchievement: We have working on Vocational Training programs, FPI training program, Wood carving training program, Jute Handicraft training program, legal awareness program, consumer awareness camp etc. After completion of the such training programs, above 100 youth already been started their business (Trade wise) in 24 pgs (N) and Hugly District, and they are well established by their business. DSWO, Hugly certified us for such training programs of our Organisation. the DM of two districts approve our work.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: DEPARTMENT OF FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES AND HORTICULTURE
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The training programme was organised to generate entrepreneur in various places of West Bengal. After successful completion of the training programe 14 trainees initiated their start up and now a days they are successful entrepreneur out of 33 trainees of that programe. Till date their food processing industries are running smoothly.

The awareness camp was sited at various market in Naihati like Anandabazar, 6No. Bazar, Kuliagarh bazar, Rajendrapur Fish market etc. to aware local people and businessman. The main objective of the programe is to make people conscious, so that they are not cheated in any way in the market of any place and insisted them on checking the weight of goods in the morning .

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: DEPARTMENT OF FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES AND HORTICULTURE
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Dept. of Food Processing Industries and Horticulture, Govt. of West Bengal committed to us for the financial assistance for the above said training programe, but after successful completion and submission of utilization certificate of the training programe, the aforesaid department did not given us a single paise till date. Mr. Jayanta Aikat, Director, Dept. Food Processing Industries and Horticulture told us verbally that they have not enough fund to give our NGO for that programe.

detailsOfAchievement: Achievements of Devarshi Yogapith : 1. Through yoga Devarshi Yogapith started yog persona was conducted in various school in Kolkata for the slow weak and marginalized students. Students were temperamental , tantrum, restless, stubborn-aggressive and self-destructive. Devarshi Yogapith worked on them through yoga to get better result and behavior out of them. 2.Devarshi Yogapith conducted courses for school principals, teachers and college lecturers. 3.Devarshi Yogapith had conducted yoga course in churches,mosque and various religious places for communal harmony. 4.Devarshi Yogapith is working from last 35 years to cure various diseases, which are not curable in medical sciences like asthma, blood pressure, heart ailments, diabetes, arthritis,etc. 5.Devarshi Yogapith is working on clinical research,training program treatment cum propagation centre,seminar,conference&workshop,published souvenir on yoga literature. 6.Conducts free keep fit yoga classes at our headquarters Howrah. Special regular classes for asthma patients & in the evening pranayam and meditation classes for general public. 7.We conduct health camp in different part of our country &also conducted one yoga camp in Armenia medical college, Armenia(on December 1992). 8.We conduct seminars on nutrition and how the food the we eat affects our mind and body. 9.We are working on sankhya philosophy,tatava theory which we know as naturopathy. 10.We conduct separate camps for old aged men and women separately. 11.We went to many other yoga organizations for joint work.(like Akhil Bhartiya Prakritik Chikitsha Parisad, Raj Ghat, New Delhi.) 12.Devarshi Yogapith works with different cultural societies for exchange of their views on Koran, Bible, Gurugranthsahab. We know that God is one and religion is one; these are but different cultures. For communal harmony we organize cultural seminars. 13.We are doing research work on swar vigyan(idaa,pingala & susumna) which is very helpful to cure various diseases. 14.We are also working with differently abled people to help increase their confidence levels. We are motivating them to use their strengths to their best possible efforts. 15.We have different exercises that help sportspersons by increasing their confidence and energy levels.

detailsOfAchievement: Development Action Society (DAS) is a woman based organization and is committed towards the development of marginalized women and children through education, health, protection and livelihoods. DAS was established in 1989 with the motto of â€œdevelopment of underprivileged women and children, regardless of their race, creed or religion; changing their world with the right kind of opportunities.â€ DAS initiated to support and strengthen the capacity of marginalized women and children in the sub-urban disadvantaged population of South and Southeast Kolkata from 1995 onwards. To fulfill our mission, DAS emphasizes on need-based interventions, serve as a resource for the field and enter partnership for funding to support priority-based projects. In the last eleven years DAS has made in-depth inroads in education, health, child protection and vocational training for sustainable transformation. Since 1995 our assistance has reached 4922 children in the age group of 3-18 years and has mainstreamed 3165 out of school children in the local govt. formal schools till 2011. Presently 1003 children are continuing in DAS run NFE centers, after school coaching support to 387 childrenâ€™s, 109 children parliament representatives, 258 active children group members. DAS also covers 8074 patients for access to health services. DAS has also reached to 33 women with adult literacy programme. Moreover, DAS has formed and capacitated 95 women group members and 88 Child Protection Committee members. Apart from this DAS also celebrates:- â€œAnnual Cultural Programmeâ€ â€“ where children demonstrate their drastic performance based on their hidden potentialities through the event of dance, songs, dramas, rhymes, poems, puppet shows and many others. â€œInternational Child Rights Week (October 14-20)â€ â€“ where children perform throughout the week based on awareness generation on Child Rights Issues. During the Child Rights Week children performed two plays on Child Rights, Child Trafficking and Right to Education and their street play in front of Silver Spring were also acknowledged for their efforts. â€œChildrenâ€™s Day Celebration (14th October)â€ â€“ where children play a huge role in Bal Utsav â€“ an awareness generation initiative on Child Rights Issues organized by DAS, â€œWorld Health Day (April 7)â€ â€“ an awareness generation initiative based on health & hygiene in schools and the area of intervention. Besides this DAS also promotes Health Camps are organized based on the Health cards and doctorâ€™s Register. Owing to this 4 health camps are organized in a year, in reference to the prevalence of diseases in the health Register. Both women and children are attended through clinical services ensuring awareness of avoiding quacks in the pockets of non-availability of health facilities. 8074 patients have been attended through these clinics, 6 cases have been referred to Government hospitals. Community needful people sententiously attended health check-up camps according to their needs and ensured their improvised health seeking behaviors. Three types special health check-up camps are being conducted on Paediatric, Skin and Gynaecology; including general health check-up camps. We provided services to 638 patients (Male â€“ 205 & Female â€“ 433) in the year of 2010 through 21 clinics and along with 32 girls less than 6 years. In the year of 2011 up to November 2011, we have provided clinical services to 1640 and along with 67 Boy and 69 Girls less than 6 years. General disease trends in these four areas are Fever, cold & cough, gastrointestinal problems e.g. diarrhoea, dysentery, hookworm infestation, hyper acidity etc.; skin problems scabies, boils, pox, prickly hits, cut & sores, others skin infections; Gynaecological problems e.g. white discharge, menstrual discontinuation, sexually transmitted infection, soiling of groins etc. and major paediatric problems are diarrhoea, dysentery, hookworm infestation, low body weight against age, cold, cough and fever. DAS is working with the physical environmental issues like maintaining sanitation in the working areas. DASâ€™s focus is to stop open defecation in all the working areas to prohibit environmental hazards. The children of DAS run schools and coaching centers receives awareness on various environmental issues like importance of plantation, personal sanitation and hygiene. As a part of work towards keeping environment green and clean, World Environment Day is observed with various activities across all the centers and plantation is a common programme in it.
